intro: Raphanus rotundus, commonly known as round radish or bird's beak, is an annual herb native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its small, round, fleshy roots that resemble a radish in appearance. The plant has alternate, pinnately compound leaves with serrated edges, and small yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Raphanus rotundus is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants.
